tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE malware_attack_vectors (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  vector_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  vector_type TEXT,
  description TEXT,
  severity INT
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerability_records (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  vulnerability_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  vulnerability_type TEXT,
  affected_systems TEXT[],
  date_discovered TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerabilities (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    severity VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'open'
);

CREATE TABLE malware_attack_vectors (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    vector_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    severity VARCHAR(50)
) 

CREATE TABLE vulnerabilities (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    vulnerability_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    affected_system VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    risk_level VARCHAR(50)
) 

CREATE TABLE attack_methods (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    method_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    success_rate DECIMAL(5,2)
) 

CREATE TABLE prevention_measures (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    measure_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    effectiveness VARCHAR(50)
) 

CREATE TABLE incidents (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_date DATE,
    incident_description TEXT,
    affected_vector_id INT,
    affected_vulnerability_id INT,
    affected_method_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (affected_vector_id) REFERENCES malware_attack_vectors(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (affected_vulnerability_id) REFERENCES vulnerabilities(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (affected_method_id) REFERENCES attack_methods(id)
)
